verses.roman:
eta bali' pīṭhā-pānā saba khāoyāilā
bhikṣā karāñā ācamana karāilā

synonyms: eta bali'-saying this; pīṭhā-pānā—many kinds of cakes and condensed-milk preparations; saba—all; khāoyāilā—made to eat; bhikṣā karāñā—after offering prasāda; ācamana karāilā—made them wash their hands, feet and mouths.
translation: After saying this, he made them all eat the various cakes and condensed-milk preparations. After feeding them, he offered them water to wash their hands, feet and mouths.
